australian.title: Australian Citizen
australian.description: Born in Australia or naturalized Australian citizen

permanent.title: Permanent Resident
permanent.description: Hold a permanent residence visa (subclass 100, 189, 190, etc.)

temporary.title: Temporary Resident
temporary.description: Hold a temporary visa (student, work, partner visa)

foreign.title: Foreign Person
foreign.description: Do not hold Australian citizenship or residency

visaType.label: What is your visa type?
visaType.description: Please select your temporary visa type

ordinarilyResident.label: Are you ordinarily resident in Australia?
ordinarilyResident.description: If you are not ordinarily resident, you may need FIRB approval even as an Australian citizen

info.australian: Australian citizens generally do not need FIRB approval unless they are not ordinarily resident in Australia.
info.permanent: Permanent residents generally do not need FIRB approval for residential property purchases.
info.temporary: Temporary residents require FIRB approval and may have restrictions on property types they can purchase.
info.foreign: Foreign persons require FIRB approval for all residential property purchases in Australia.

approval.requiredDesc: You must obtain FIRB approval before purchasing this property.

costs.title: Cost Breakdown

analysisParams.description: These inputs were captured during the wizard. Adjust them in the financial step to refine your analysis.
analysisParams.note: You'll return to the Financial step to edit rent, vacancy, growth, or rate assumptions.

disclaimer.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: The estimates and outputs generated by the PropertyCosts.com.au calculator are for illustrative and hypothetical purposes only. This information constitutes General Advice and does not take into account your personal objectives, financial situation, or needs. We have not considered whether the information or the hypothetical scenarios generated are suitable for your specific circumstances. The results must not be relied upon as professional legal, financial, or tax advice, and are not a substitute for consulting a qualified professional. Before making any property investment, finance, or legal decisions, you should seek independent advice from a licensed financial planner, tax professional, or legal practitioner.

toggle.title: Investment Analytics
toggle.description: See rental yields, ROI, 10-year projections, cash flow analysis, and compare against other investments

summary.title: Investment Performance Summary
summary.description: Key metrics at a glance based on your investment assumptions

score.title: Investment Score
score.description: Comprehensive analysis of your investment opportunity

taxAnalysis.title: Tax Analysis
taxAnalysis.description: Tax implications and deductions for your investment property
taxAnalysis.taxPlanningTip: You should speak with a qualified tax advisor to optimize your investment structure and maximize tax benefits. Tax laws and rates can change, affecting your calculations.

sensitivity.title: Sensitivity Analysis
sensitivity.description: How changes in key variables affect your investment returns
sensitivity.warningDesc: These scenarios show how changes in key variables could impact your investment. Results are estimates and actual outcomes may vary.
sensitivity.vacancyDesc: How vacancy rates affect rental income
sensitivity.vacancyNote: Note: Vacancy rates significantly impact rental income and cash flow.
sensitivity.interestDesc: How interest rate changes affect loan repayments
sensitivity.growthDesc: How different growth rates affect your investment

comparison.title: Investment Comparison
comparison.description: Compare your property investment against other investment options over {years} years
comparison.comparisonDesc: {best} returned {return} over {years} years, compared to your property investment of {propertyReturn}
comparison.propertyLeadsDesc: Your property investment returned {return} over {years} years with an annualized return of {rate}%
comparison.assumptions: Assumptions: Property growth at {growth}% p.a., ASX at 7.2% p.a., Bonds at 4.5% p.a., Term Deposit at 4% p.a., Savings at 4.5% p.a. Returns are estimates based on historical averages.

cashFlow.title: Cash Flow Analysis
cashFlow.description: Detailed breakdown of your rental income and expenses

inputs.title: Investment Analysis Parameters
inputs.description: Adjust these values to see how different scenarios affect your investment returns
inputs.note: These are estimates based on current market conditions and typical investor scenarios. Actual results may vary based on specific circumstances, market changes, and individual tax situations.

notes.pastPerformance: Past performance does not guarantee future results.

HomePage.title: Australian Property Investment Analysis
HomePage.subtitle: Comprehensive analysis for Australian property investments

features.sectionTitle: Everything You Need to Make Informed Decisions

costCalculator.title: Cost Calculator
costCalculator.description: Calculate every upfront and ongoing cost for Australian property purchases.

investmentAnalysis.title: Investment Analysis
investmentAnalysis.description: Forecast rental income, cash flow, and ROI with benchmark data.

firbEligibility.title: FIRB Eligibility
firbEligibility.description: Understand FIRB rules, visa requirements, and compliance timelines.

detailedReports.title: Detailed Reports
detailedReports.description: View comprehensive investment analysis reports with detailed insights and recommendations.

costCalculator.heading: What costs are there in buying a property?
costCalculator.body: Model the complete cost base for any Australian property — from stamp duty and FIRB fees to legal work and inspections.

points.one: Automatic stamp duty, FIRB, and foreign buyer surcharge calculations for every state
points.two: Break down loan establishment, management, insurance, and maintenance expenses
points.three: Compare scenarios by property type, price, and deposit to stress-test your budget

investmentAnalysis.heading: How will my investment perform?
investmentAnalysis.body: Forecast rental yields, cash flow, and capital growth using benchmark data plus your own assumptions.

points.one: Dynamic ROI models with sensitivity analysis for rent, rates, and interest changes
points.two: Cash flow charts that show gross vs net returns, tax effects, and gearing
points.three: Long-term projections showing property value growth and equity accumulation over time

firbEligibility.heading: What extra costs and rules apply for foreign investors?
firbEligibility.body: Clarify whether FIRB approval is required, estimate the fee, and understand the visa-specific rules and exemptions that apply to your situation.

points.one: Guidance for temporary residents, companies, and trust structures
points.two: Explain timelines, documentation, and what happens if you breach conditions
points.three: Highlight ongoing obligations such as vacancy fees and reporting

firbEligibility.imageAlt: FIRB eligibility result showing status, requirements, and recommendations

detailedReports.heading: What must I know before I invest?
detailedReports.body: View comprehensive reports that explain your assumptions, risks, and next steps so you can invest with confidence.

points.one: Executive summaries covering costs, eligibility, and investment metrics
points.two: Scenario comparisons, cash flow tables, and sensitivity analysis sections
points.three: Clear disclaimers and action checklists tailored to foreign investors

detailedReports.imageAlt: Detailed property investment report showing cost breakdown, eligibility status, and analysis

leadCapture.title: Stay Updated on Property Investment Insights
leadCapture.description: Get notified about new features, investment tips, and market updates.
leadCapture.helper: Be the first to hear about FIRB updates, rate shifts, and new analytics tools.

Footer.companyDescription: Comprehensive property investment analysis for Australia
Footer.copyright: © 2025 Property Fee Calculator. All rights reserved.
Footer.disclaimerText: The estimates and outputs generated by the PropertyCosts.com.au calculator are for illustrative and hypothetical purposes only. This information constitutes General Advice and does not take into account your personal objectives, financial situation, or needs. We have not considered whether the information or the hypothetical scenarios generated are suitable for your specific circumstances. The results must not be relied upon as professional legal, financial, or tax advice, and are not a substitute for consulting a qualified professional. Before making any property investment, finance, or legal decisions, you should seek independent advice from a licensed financial planner, tax professional, or legal practitioner.

benchmarks.title: Benchmark Data Management
benchmarks.description: Manage rental yield and capital growth benchmarks by state and suburb
benchmarks.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this benchmark?

csvImport.title: Import Benchmarks from CSV
csvImport.description: Upload a CSV file to bulk import benchmark data. The CSV should have columns: state, suburb_name (optional), postcode (optional), gross_rental_yield, net_rental_yield, capital_growth_5yr, capital_growth_10yr, data_source, data_quality_score, notes, is_active.

BetaBanner.message: This service is currently in beta development. Help us improve by sharing your feedback!

emailModal.title: Stay Updated
emailModal.description: Enter your email to receive updates about new features, improvements, and important announcements.
